channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Dow tumbles 1,000 points for the worst day since 2020, Nasdaq drops 5%
item.description: Stocks reversed Wednesday's rally and then fell back toward their lowest levels of the year.

item.title: E-commerce stocks plummet as consumers pull back online spending
item.description: Shares of Etsy, Shopify, Wayfair, Poshmark and a number of other e-commerce retailers were falling Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Tech sell-off pushes Nasdaq to steepest drop since June 2020
item.description: E-commerce and cloud stocks led the decline in technology, which was hit particularly hard after the Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate.

item.title: Lucid reports 30,000 EV reservations and raises prices on its Air sedans
item.description: Lucid said that it now has 30,000 reservations for its Air luxury sedan — and it's raising prices in June.

item.title: Bank of England hikes interest rates to 13-year high, sees inflation hitting 10%
item.description: The Bank of England on Thursday raised interest rates to their highest level in 13 years in a bid to tackle soaring inflation.

item.title: F1 CEO sees 'great opportunity' in TV rights talks with ESPN deal due to expire
item.description: The racing league's current deal with ESPN expires at the end of 2022.

item.title: British pound plummets as Bank of England warns of recession risk
item.description: Bank of England policymakers warned that GDP growth is expected to slow sharply and inflation could peak at 10% this year.

item.title: World’s second-largest hydropower plant set for 14-year upgrade after deal with GE
item.description: Itaipu commenced electricity production in 1984.

item.title: From Estee Lauder to Apple, big companies say China's Covid restrictions are hitting business
item.description: Across industries, companies say China's Covid controls are taking a toll — so much so that some executives warn of more unpredictable performance ahead.

item.title: Binance is backing Elon Musk's Twitter bid, boosting crypto believers' vision of a 'decentralized' web
item.description: Changpeng Zhao, Binance's CEO, is a big believer in the crypto world's vision of a new kind of internet, known as Web3.

item.title: Elon Musk expected to serve as temporary Twitter CEO after deal closes
item.description: Elon Musk is expected to serve as a temporary Twitter CEO for a few months after he completes his takeover of the company, sources told CNBC's David Faber.

item.title: Elon Musk got another $7 billion from friends and investors to buy Twitter
item.description: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, venture capital firm Sequoia and crypto exchange Binance are among the investors that plan to support Elon Musk's Twitter bid.

item.title: Your kids can learn life lessons from investing and trading in stocks — here's how
item.description: The barrier to entry into the stock market has been progressively lower, especially for young traders. What can kids gain from learning to invest and trade?

item.title: Oil giant Shell reports highest quarterly profit since 2008 on soaring commodity prices
item.description: Shell's bumper earnings echo profits seen across the oil and gas industry, even as many energy majors incur costly write-downs from exiting Russia.

item.title: OPEC+ agrees to another modest production increase after EU outlines Russian oil ban
item.description: Oil producer group OPEC+ on Thursday agreed to rubber-stamp another small production increase for June.

item.title: Chinese tech giant NetEase launches first gaming studio in U.S. in international push
item.description: The studio, called Jackalope Games, is based in Austin, TX and will be tasked with creating new PC and console games for NetEase.

item.title: Law firm says employees can work from home full-time – but only if they take a 20% pay cut
item.description: A U.K. law firm has decided to offer its employees the option of working from home full-time, but on the condition that they take a 20% pay cut.

item.title: Bill Gates questions Elon Musk's goals with Twitter: 'He could make it worse'
item.description: Bill Gates has warned that Elon Musk could make Twitter worse after the Tesla CEO pledged to buy the social media firm for $44 billion.

item.title: Volkswagen is prolonging its use of coal due to Russian energy 'threat'
item.description: VW chief Herbert Diess' comments were made during an interview with CNBC's Annette Weisbach.

item.title: India's high inflation will likely persist despite surprise rate hike, says economist
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India on Wednesday surprised markets by raising the key borrowing rate for the first time in nearly four years.

item.title: This 35-year-old turned her eBay side hustle into a $141 million company: 'Here's the business plan I used'
item.description: In 2014, Tori Gerbig quit her $35,000-per-year job to grow her e-commerce side hustle, Pink Lily. Today, she runs the $141 million company full-time with her husband. The 35-year-old entrepreneur shares the simple five-step business plan she used.

item.title: Dow rallies 900 points as investors bet the Fed can slow inflation without causing a recession
item.description: Stocks surged as investors digested the Federal Reserve's big interest rate decision on Wednesday.

item.title: Mainland China stocks rise on return to trade, as Asia stocks mostly climb following Fed rate hike
item.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve on Wednesday increased its benchmark interest rate by half a percentage point, in line with market expectations.

item.title: Miami hosts its first F1 Grand Prix this weekend, and thousands of fans are spending a ton just to be in town
item.description: Miami's top hotels, restaurants and night clubs are offering high-priced packages for race-goers.

item.title: Consumers at breaking point as Fed's inflation battle heats up, investor Peter Boockvar warns
item.description: Investor Peter Boockvar warns the Federal Reserve will not be able to meaningfully contain surging inflation, and there's not much more consumers can withstand.

item.title: Cramer says Wednesday's relief rally won't vanquish the bears, expects Fed skeptics to remain
item.description: Despite Wall Street's relief rally Wednesday afternoon, CNBC's Jim Cramer said he expects Fed skeptics to remain and continue selling stocks.

item.title: Bitcoin jumps to $40,000 after Fed chair Powell rules out bigger rate hikes
item.description: The cryptocurrency rallied after the central bank raised interest rates by half of a percentage point.

item.title: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi says U.S. regulator is investigating its $4 billion IPO
item.description: Shortly after Didi went public in the U.S. last year, Chinese regulators opened up a cybersecurity probe into the company.

item.title: A slate of EV automakers report earnings this week and will try to prove they can turn hype into production
item.description: All three stocks are down sharply from highs: Can the companies regain momentum?

item.title: Jim Cramer reveals how he invests his own money—and why he keeps 50% in cash
item.description: Jim Cramer, host of CNBC's stock-trading show "Mad Money," doesn't own individual stocks and keeps half of his portfolio in cash.
